meanings.definition: A device that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.
meanings.sent1: The alternators in cars help charge the battery.
meanings.sent2: Mechanics often check alternators when diagnosing electrical issues.
meanings.sent3: The alternators at the power plant were feeling energized today!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like alternators, transforming ideas into power.
meanings.sent5: The alternators hummed as they worked tirelessly to produce electricity.

meanings.definition: A device that produces alternating current.
meanings.sent1: The alternators in the generator ensure a steady flow of electricity.
meanings.sent2: Electricians know how to test alternators for proper function.
meanings.sent3: The alternators at the concert were the real stars of the show!
meanings.sent4: His voice was like alternators, switching between highs and lows effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The alternators buzzed softly as they powered the lights in the room.

meanings.definition: A machine that generates electricity by rotating a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The alternators in wind turbines harness wind power efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Engineers design alternators to be reliable and durable.
meanings.sent3: The alternators in the science experiment were shocking everyone!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like alternators lighting up a dark street.
meanings.sent5: The alternators whirred as they converted motion into electrical energy.
